definitions: person skilled in planning strategies and maneuvers to achieve goals
military professional who specializes in battlefield tactics and operational planning
examples: The chess champion proved himself a brilliant tactician during tournaments
Political campaigns often hire experienced tacticians to guide their strategies
Napoleon was considered one of history's greatest military tacticians
The general's chief tactician outlined three possible approaches to the siege

definitions: very small degree or quantity of something
examples: Could you turn the music down just a tad please
The soup needs a tad more salt for perfect seasoning

definitions: aquatic larval stage of frogs and toads with gills and tail
examples: The pond was teeming with hundreds of tiny black tadpoles
Children watched tadpoles gradually develop legs in the classroom aquarium

definitions: Korean martial art emphasizing high kicks, jumping techniques, and disciplined mental training
examples: She earned her black belt in taekwondo after five years of training
The Olympics featured exciting taekwondo matches between world-class competitors

definitions: soft chewy candy made from boiled sugar or molasses stretched repeatedly
examples: The boardwalk shop sold saltwater taffy in twenty different flavors
Children pulled the warm taffy until it turned pale and glossy

definitions: small piece of material attached for identification or information
playground game where one player chases others to touch them
stylized signature or symbol used by graffiti artists
keyword or label assigned to digital content for organization
examples: The price tag showed the shirt was on sale for half off
Don't forget to remove the tags before wearing your new dress
The children played tag during recess until the bell rang
You're it now that I tagged you on the shoulder
The artist's distinctive tag appeared on walls throughout the city
Police recognized the tag from previous vandalism incidents
Adding relevant tags helps people find your social media posts
The blog post included tags for easy categorization and searching

definitions: Chinese martial art practiced for defense training, health benefits, and meditation through slow flowing movements
examples: Elderly people gathered in the park for morning taichi exercises
The taichi master demonstrated the form with perfect balance and grace

definitions: flexible appendage extending from the rear of an animal's body
rear or back end of something extending behind
person or vehicle following another for surveillance purposes
examples: The dog wagged its tail enthusiastically when its owner returned home
The peacock displayed its magnificent tail feathers during courtship
The tail of the comet stretched millions of miles through space
Passengers boarded the plane through a door near the tail section
The detective put a tail on the suspect to monitor his activities
She noticed a car had been tailing her for several blocks

definitions: long line of slow or stationary traffic extending back from obstruction
offensive player in American football positioned behind the quarterback
examples: The accident caused a five-mile tailback on the highway during rush hour
Drivers were warned about tailbacks near the construction zone
The tailback rushed for over 100 yards in the championship game
College scouts watched the talented tailback break several tackles

definitions: hinged door at the back of a truck or station wagon
social gathering in parking area before sporting events featuring food and drinks
act of driving dangerously close behind another vehicle
examples: He lowered the tailgate to unload the lumber from his pickup truck
The SUV's automatic tailgate opened with the press of a button
Fans arrived early for tailgate parties before the football game
Their tailgate featured grilled burgers and cold beverages
The aggressive driver was tailgating me on the freeway
Police ticketed him for tailgating and reckless driving

definitions: residue of ore or waste material left after extraction process
act of secretly following someone to observe their activities
examples: Mining companies must properly dispose of tailings to prevent environmental damage
The pond contained toxic tailings from decades of copper mining
The private investigator specialized in tailing unfaithful spouses
After three days of tailing, they gathered enough evidence

definitions: person who makes, alters, or repairs clothing professionally to fit individual customers
examples: The tailor measured him carefully for a custom-made suit
She took the dress to a tailor for alterations

definitions: craft or business of making and altering clothing to fit individuals
process of adapting something to meet specific requirements or needs
examples: His impeccable tailoring was evident in every suit he wore
She learned tailoring from her grandmother who was a seamstress
The company specializes in tailoring software solutions for small businesses
The course requires tailoring the curriculum to student needs

definitions: trace of contamination, infection, or undesirable quality affecting something
suggestion of corruption or dishonor affecting reputation or character
examples: The laboratory detected a taint of bacteria in the water supply
Even a slight taint can ruin an entire batch of wine
The scandal left a permanent taint on his political career
The company worked to remove any taint of association with fraud

definitions: amount of something captured or collected in single instance
single continuous recording of a performance or scene
particular interpretation or perspective on a situation or issue
examples: The charity event's take exceeded fifty thousand dollars
The thieves made off with their take from the robbery
The director was satisfied with the third take of the scene
The band recorded the song in just one take
What's your take on the new company policy changes
His unique take on the classic play surprised audiences

definitions: prepared food purchased from restaurant for consumption elsewhere
main point or lesson learned from an experience or presentation
examples: Let's order Chinese takeaway instead of cooking tonight
The takeaway restaurant offers free delivery within five miles
The main takeaway from the conference was the importance of innovation
What are your key takeaways from today's training session

definitions: wrestling or combat move to bring opponent to the ground
removal of online content due to legal or policy violations
systematic dismantling or comprehensive criticism of an argument or position
examples: The wrestler executed a perfect takedown in the first round
Police officers are trained in safe takedown techniques
The company issued a takedown notice for copyright infringement
Social media platforms process thousands of takedown requests daily
Her article was a devastating takedown of the proposed legislation
The debate featured a methodical takedown of his opponent's arguments

definitions: act of aircraft leaving the ground and beginning flight
period of sudden rapid growth or successful development
humorous imitation or parody of someone's behavior or style
examples: The pilot announced takeoff would be delayed due to weather
Passengers must fasten seatbelts during takeoff and landing
The company experienced a dramatic takeoff after launching their app
Economic takeoff occurred when foreign investment increased
His takeoff of the president's speech had everyone laughing
The comedian's takeoff on celebrity culture was brilliantly observed

definitions: food ordered from restaurant for consumption elsewhere
deliberate elimination or assassination of a specific target
examples: We ordered takeout from the Italian restaurant down the street
The takeout menu includes all their regular dishes
The spy novel featured a takeout of the enemy agent
Military commanders planned the takeout of key installations

definitions: acquisition of one company by another through purchase or merger
act of assuming control or power especially by force
examples: The hostile takeover bid valued the company at two billion dollars
Shareholders voted to approve the friendly takeover
The military takeover resulted in suspension of democratic government
Rebels attempted a takeover of the radio station

definitions: person who accepts or receives something offered
person who takes an examination or test
examples: There were no takers for the challenging volunteer position
The seller finally found a taker for the antique furniture
Test takers must arrive thirty minutes before the exam begins
The new format confused many first-time takers

definitions: money received especially from sales or business transactions
act of gaining possession or control of something
examples: The theater's takings for the weekend exceeded expectations
Daily takings are deposited in the bank each evening
The taking of photographs is prohibited in the museum
His taking of credit for others' work angered colleagues

definitions: soft white, gray, or green mineral used in powder form for various applications
examples: The geologist identified deposits of talc in the mountain formation
Baby powder traditionally contained talc as its main ingredient

definitions: narrative or story, especially one that is imaginative or fictional
deliberately false or exaggerated account intended to deceive
examples: Grandmother told tales of her childhood in the old country
The book contains folk tales from various cultures
Don't believe his tales about why he was late
The suspect spun a tale to avoid prosecution

definitions: natural aptitude or skill in a particular area or activity
person possessing exceptional natural ability in particular area
ancient unit of weight and currency used in biblical times
examples: She has a remarkable talent for learning languages quickly
His talent for music was evident from an early age
The company actively recruits young talent from top universities
Local talent performed at the community arts festival
The parable mentions servants given different numbers of talents
A talent of silver was worth considerable money in ancient times

definitions: object believed to contain magical properties providing protection or bringing good luck
examples: The warrior carried a talisman into battle for protection
She wore her grandmother's ring as a talisman against evil

definitions: informal conversation or chat between people
formal speech or lecture given to an audience
discussion or negotiations about a particular topic
examples: We had a long talk about our future plans together
The friends met for coffee and a talk
The professor gave an inspiring talk on climate change
Her TED talk has been viewed millions of times
Peace talks between the nations resumed after a brief pause
There's been talk of restructuring the department

definitions: person who talks frequently or is skilled at conversation
examples: She's quite a talker once you get her started on politics
The baby is becoming quite the little talker

definitions: act or activity of speaking or having conversation
subject or focus of discussion and consideration
examples: The teacher asked students to stop talking during the test
Talking helps children develop their language skills
The new policy became the main talking point at the meeting
His resignation was the talking of the entire office

definitions: record or count of scores, amounts, or items calculated
notched stick historically used for keeping count or records
examples: The final tally showed 500 votes in favor of the proposal
Keep a tally of how many customers visit each day
Medieval merchants used wooden tallies to record debts
The tally stick was split between creditor and debtor

definitions: sharp curved claw of a bird of prey used for hunting
examples: The eagle gripped its prey firmly in its powerful talons
Owls have specially adapted talons for silent hunting

definitions: round flat Scottish cap with a pompom in the center
examples: He wore a traditional tam with his Highland dress
The green tam matched her Scottish dancing outfit perfectly

definitions: traditional Mexican dish of seasoned meat wrapped in corn dough and steamed in corn husks
examples: Grandmother makes dozens of tamales for the holiday celebration
The restaurant serves authentic chicken and pork tamales

definitions: tropical tree producing pod-like fruits with edible pulp
brown pod-like fruit with sweet-sour pulp used in cooking
examples: The tamarind tree provided shade in the tropical garden
Ancient tamarind trees lined the village square
She added tamarind paste to give the curry a tangy flavor
Fresh tamarind pods are sold at the Asian market

definitions: handheld percussion instrument with metal jingles around a circular frame
examples: She played the tambourine during the folk music performance
The child shook the tambourine enthusiastically to the rhythm

definitions: person who trains wild animals to be obedient or perform
examples: The lion tamer performed daring acts in the circus ring
Horse tamers work patiently to gain the animal's trust

definitions: tool used to pack down or compress material such as soil or tobacco
examples: He used a tamper to pack the tobacco in his pipe
The construction worker used a tamper to compact the gravel

definitions: act of interfering with something improperly, illegally, or without authorization
examples: Evidence tampering is a serious criminal offense
The company discovered tampering with their product packaging

definitions: yellowish-brown color resembling tanned leather
darkening of skin from exposure to sun or UV light
process of treating animal hides to produce leather
examples: She chose a tan jacket to match her boots
The walls were painted in a warm tan shade
He got a nice tan during his beach vacation
Use sunscreen to avoid getting too much tan
The factory specializes in the tan of exotic leathers
Traditional tan methods use tree bark extracts

definitions: bicycle designed for two riders sitting one behind the other
arrangement where two things work together or are positioned consecutively
examples: The couple enjoyed riding their tandem along the coastal path
Learning to ride a tandem requires coordination between both riders
The two departments work in tandem to complete projects
The medications should be used in tandem for best results

definitions: strong, sharp flavor or smell that is distinctive
projecting part of a blade that extends into the handle
examples: The cheese has a pleasant tang that pairs well with wine
There's a citrus tang to this salad dressing
The knife's full tang extends through the entire handle
A broken tang means the blade needs replacement

definitions: straight line that touches a curve at exactly one point
topic or direction of thought that diverges from the main subject
examples: Draw a tangent to the circle at point A
The tangent forms a right angle with the radius
Sorry for going off on a tangent about my vacation
The professor often goes on tangents during lectures

definitions: small sweet orange-colored citrus fruit with loose skin
bright reddish-orange color resembling the fruit
examples: She peeled the tangerine and shared the segments with friends
Fresh tangerines are abundant during winter months
The sunset painted the sky in brilliant tangerine hues
She wore a tangerine dress to the summer party

definitions: confused mass of intertwined threads, hair, or similar material
complicated or confused situation that is difficult to resolve
examples: She carefully brushed the tangles from her daughter's hair
The fishing line formed a hopeless tangle
The legal tangle took months to sort out
International negotiations became a tangle of competing interests

definitions: passionate ballroom dance of Argentine origin performed by couples
letter T in the NATO phonetic alphabet used in communications
examples: They took tango lessons for their wedding dance
The tango requires close coordination between partners
The pilot confirmed 'Tango' for the letter T in the flight code
Military personnel use 'Tango' in radio communications

definitions: large container for storing liquids or gas
heavily armored military combat vehicle with tracks and weapons
glass container for keeping fish or other aquatic animals
examples: The fuel tank holds fifty gallons of gasoline
Water is stored in tanks on the roof
Tanks rolled through the city during the military parade
The army deployed tanks to the conflict zone
The tropical fish swam gracefully in the large tank
She cleaned the tank and changed the water weekly

definitions: large drinking cup with handle and sometimes hinged lid typically made of metal
examples: He raised his pewter tankard in a toast to the king
The medieval tavern served ale in traditional tankards

definitions: large ship designed to transport liquid cargo like oil
truck designed to carry liquids in a large tank
examples: The oil tanker navigated carefully through the narrow strait
Environmental concerns arose after the tanker spill
The milk tanker delivers to dairy processing plants daily
A fuel tanker supplies gas stations throughout the region

definitions: person who tans animal hides to make leather
former British sixpence coin used before decimalization
examples: The tanner worked with various chemicals to process the hides
Medieval tanners formed important trade guilds
He found an old tanner among his grandfather's coin collection
A tanner was worth six old pence

definitions: facility where animal hides are processed and converted into leather
examples: The old tannery has been converted into luxury apartments
Workers at the tannery use traditional leather-making methods
